page.title: 03FARMING:grass - S of Waltham
page.content: Grass-land is used for three purposes: 1. Pasture - either for sheep or fattening cattle, or for dairy herds. Being an important hunting area, grazing is also used for horses. 2. Silage - is made from cut grass which after consolidation in a clamp is then covered to keep the air out. It is then common practice to weight down the cover with bales or old vehicle tyres. 3. Hay - like silage is used for animal feed during the winter. The grass is mown and dried in the fields, turning frquently. When dried the hay is baled. As with straw both circular and rectangular bales can be made, the latter being more labour intensive, both during the baling stage and when required for feeding stock in the fields.
